trans-unit.source: Specifies the reason why a cache entry was removed or an entry is about to be removed.
The <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedReason> enumeration is used to provide a predefined set of reasons why a cache entry was removed or is about to be removed.
The <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedArguments> class takes a <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedReason> value as one of the parameter to pass to a callback method.
A cache entry was evicted for as reason that is defined by a particular cache implementation.
A cache entry was removed because a related dependency (such as a file or another cache entry) triggered eviction of the cache entry.
A cache entry was removed to free memory in the cache.
This occurs when a cache instance approaches cache-specific memory limits, or when a process or cache instance approaches computer-wide memory limits.
A cache entry was removed because it expired.
Expiration can be based on an absolute time or on a sliding expiration time.

A cache entry was removed by using the <xref href="System.Runtime.Caching.ObjectCache.Remove(System.String,System.String)"></xref> or <xref href="System.Runtime.Caching.ObjectCache.Set(System.String,System.Object,System.DateTimeOffset,System.String)"></xref> method.
